The main differences are in configuration, logging, and minor implementation details. Both scripts are syntactically valid, with only superficial differences in error handling and environment abstraction. Overall, both provide highly effective, automatable validation frameworks with minor style and interface divergences.

Both scripts automate the ABAP-to-PySpark migration validation workflow, including ABAP/PySpark code parsing, simulated or real ABAP execution, CSV/Parquet conversion, PySpark table loading, transformation, comparison, and reconciliation reporting. '1.0 1/ABAP_To_PySpark_Recon_Tester.txt' is more simulation-focused while '2.0 1/abap_to_pyspark_recon_tester.txt' includes real SAP/Boto3 hooks. Both achieve the same validation objectives.

Overall structure is nearly identical: both scripts follow a stepwise validation pipeline with modular, reusable functions/classes. '2.0 1/abap_to_pyspark_recon_tester.txt' splits more logic into utility functions and supports more storage types and configuration via environment variables (lines 35-90), whereas '1.0 1/ABAP_To_PySpark_Recon_Tester.txt' uses a class-based approach and hardcoded simulation paths. Minor differences in error handling and logging structure.
